page.title: 20Lindum Nurseries, Eversley
page.content: {Lindum Nurseries}was built in 1928. Lindum is the Latin name for Lincoln, where the original owners came from. The present owners, the{ {Barker family,}have been running the business since 1946. They have three and a half acres of land, including fourteen greenhouses. They grow tomatoes, bedding and pot plants. They employ up to eight people, depending on the time of year and how busy they are. They produce between seventy-five and a hundred tons of tomatoes in a season and twenty thousand boxes of plants (about half a million plants). The nurseries are situated on the A327 the main road to Reading, so they attract passing trade. Mr. Barker told us that they also need to advertise to maintain trading levels. Their main problems are greenfly, slugs, fungus and the weather.
